# My Release Notes

> My Release Notes (myreleasenotes.ai) tracks GitHub releases for the packages developers depend on. It provides AI-powered summaries, smart filtering, and notifications so you never miss a release that matters.

## Key Features

- Track GitHub releases for any package (npm, Python, Go, Rust, etc.)
- AI-powered release note summaries that highlight what matters
- Personalized watchlist and notification preferences
- Dark mode, smart filtering by severity and relevance
- Free tier available

## Pages

- [Homepage](https://www.myreleasenotes.ai/): Overview of the service and how it works
- [About](https://www.myreleasenotes.ai/about): About My Release Notes
- [Pricing](https://www.myreleasenotes.ai/pricing): Plans and pricing
- [Privacy Policy](https://www.myreleasenotes.ai/privacy): Privacy policy

## Browsing Packages

Package pages are available at `https://www.myreleasenotes.ai/packages/{owner}/{repo}` where `{owner}` is the GitHub organization or user and `{repo}` is the repository name. For example:

- [facebook/react](https://www.myreleasenotes.ai/packages/facebook/react): Release notes for React
- [microsoft/TypeScript](https://www.myreleasenotes.ai/packages/microsoft/TypeScript): Release notes for TypeScript
- [vercel/next.js](https://www.myreleasenotes.ai/packages/vercel/next.js): Release notes for Next.js

Individual release pages are at `https://www.myreleasenotes.ai/releases/{releaseId}`.

## Optional

- [Sitemap](https://api.myreleasenotes.ai/sitemap.xml): XML sitemap of all indexed packages
